question.feedback: A is correct. Flex defines subclasses of Group: HGroup with a horizontal layout, VGroup with a vertical layout, and TileGroup with a tile layout.

question.feedback: D is correct. SelectedIndex The index of the currently active container if one or more child containers are defined. The value of this property is -1 if no child containers are defined.

item.question: Which property is used to get current selected item in viewstack?

item.question: Which method is used to change style at runtime?

question.feedback: D is correct.The horizontalCenter or verticalCenter constraints specify the distance between the container's center and the element's center. Set the horizontalCenter or verticalCenter constraints to zero to center the element within the container in the horizontal or vertical direction.

item.question: To center the Spark Group container to its parent, which following is right.

question.feedback: A is correct.The LayoutBase and ILayoutElement interfaces are designed with 3D support in mind. There are already 3D custom layouts examples floating around the web,including CoverFlow, Carousel, and WheelLayout to name a few.

item.question: Which component used to create Carousel layout?

question.feedback: B is correct.The SkinnableComponent class defines the base class for skinnable components. The skins used by a SkinnableComponent class are typically child classes of the Skin class.

item.question: Which of the following class used in Skinnable Component to define the Skin?

question.feedback: A is correct.Descendant selectors are applied to components in a document, depending on their relationship to other components in the document. A descendant selector lets you apply styles to a component based on whether they descend (are children, grandchildren,or great grandchildren) from particular types of components.

item.question: Which selector is applied to components in a document, depending on their relationship to other components in the document.

item.question: How to use constraint layout in Spark Components?

question.feedback: B is correct.Pseudo selectors let you apply styles to a component when that component is in a particular state that is when it is up,down,over states.

item.question: Which selector is applied to components when that component is in a particular state.

question.feedback: C is correct.Flex includes a set of standard validator components for data such as phone numbers, social security numbers, and ZIP codes. You can also create your own custom validator.

item.question: In Validators, the target element can be accessed through property?

question.feedback: D is correct.The data model feature lets you store data in client-side objects. A data model is an ActionScript object that contains properties for storing data, and that optionally contains methods for additional functionality. Data models are useful for partitioning the user interface and data in an application.

item.question: What are required to achieve Data Driven Model?
item.answer: you store data in client-side objects.
useful for partitioning the user interface and data in an application
it is an ActionScript object that contains properties for storing data

question.feedback: C is correct.A value from the BlendMode class that specifies which blend mode to use. A bitmap can be drawn internally in two ways. If you have a blend mode enabled or an external clipping mask, the bitmap is drawn by adding a bitmap-filled square shape to the vector render.

item.question: Change the look and feel of a design by using API styles, style sheets, filters, and blends. Which is the correct syntax?

question.feedback: C is correct.Data binding is the process of tying the data in one object to another object. Adobe Flex provides three ways to specify data binding: the curly braces ({}) syntax in MXML, the <fx:Binding> tag in MXML, and the BindingUtils methods in ActionScript

item.question: Which line of the following code correctly binds the text property of a Label to the selectedValue of a RadioButtonGroup with an id of cardType?

question.feedback: D is correct.Informs the NativeDragManager object that the specified target interactive object can accept a drop corresponding to the current drag event.This method should be called only when there is a nativeDragDrop handler on the specified target object that can handle at least one of the data formats in the dragged item and at least one of the allowed actions

item.question: Which method of the NativeDragManager class will approve the current drag event?

question.feedback: B and C are correct. Using virtual layouts and defining typical objects will ensure less overhead when Flex creates item renderers for a Spark List-based control. With virtual layout enabled, when a child is moved off the visible area of the container, its item renderer is recycled. By defining the typical item, the container does not have to size each child as it is drawn on the screen.

item.question: Which will reduce the overhead involved in creating item renderers for a Spark List-based control? Choose two:
item.answer: Use a virtual layout for the item renderer

question.feedback: B is correct. States are not defined within the declarations section, they are defined within the main MXML content. The other three items are defined in the declarations section.

item.question: Which of the following is NOT defined in the <fx:Declarations> section?

question.feedback: C is correct. By default, the prompt area is empty when the control first loads. Selecting a data item in the drop-down list sets the prompt to the data item.Use the prompt property to define the text to display when the DropDownList loads.

item.question: Which of the following property is used to define the text to display when the DropDownList loads?

question.feedback: True, The default layout class of the SkinnableContainer class is BasicLayout. In this example, the SkinnableContainer uses the HorizontalLayout class to arrange the buttons in a single row.

item.question: True or False: The default layout class of the SkinnableContainer class is BasicLayout.

question.feedback: False. The Group container can, by default, be a child of the Scroller control and therefore support scroll bars. The SkinnableContainer, however, must implement a custom skin in order to support scrolling.

item.question: True or False? By default Both the Group and SkinnableContainer containers is a child of the Scroller control?

question.feedback: B is correct. You can use an item renderer function to examine each data item to determine which item renderer to use. The DataGroup.itemRendererFunction and SkinnableDataContainer.itemRendererFunction property takes a function with the following signature: function itemRendererFunction(item:Object):ClassFactory

item.question: Which class is used to return from the itemRendererFunction of SkinnableDataContainer?

question.feedback: A is correct. Flex includes a global selector that you can use to apply styles to all controls. Properties defined by a global selector apply to every control unless that control explicitly overrides it. Because the global selector is like a type selector, you do not preface its definition with a period in CSS.

item.question: Which of the following is the correct way to declare a global selector in an external style sheet to apply styles.? Choose one:

question.feedback: C is correct. You cannot use type selectors in an MXML component. The resulting code will produce a warning, but Button one's label will ignore the type selector, and Button two's label will be white because its styleName property is set to a class selector in the style declaration.

item.answer: Both Button labels will be white
Both Button labels will be black
Button one's label will be Yellow and Button two's label white
Button one's label will be white and Button two's label black

question.feedback: B is correct. Flex supports using an id selector. Flex applies styles to a component whose id matches the id selector in the CSS. To define an id selector, specify the id of the component with a pound sign (#) followed by the id string. The id selector can be qualified by the type or by itself.

item.question: Which of the following options shows the correct use of an ID selector in a CSS style sheet? Choose two:

question.feedback: True, you can override the layout specified in the skin simply by setting the layout property to a new layout.

item.question: True or False: SkinnableContainer overrides the layout specified in the skin by setting the layout property.

question.feedback: D is correct. Since the minimum default width and height of the HGroup is 0 and no sizing is set, the HGroup container will only be as big as the child it contains and therefore not appear to be centered on the Panel even though the alignment properties are set as such. Setting the width and height of the HGroup to 100% to match the panel size will show the button centered horizontally and vertically.

item.question: Which of the following statements is the correct way to set a skin class in ActionScript?

question.feedback: False, if you create a custom theme for your application, or if you do not need support for global Spark styles in your custom skin class, you can use Skin rather than SparkSkin as your custom skinâ€™s root tag. The SparkSkin class adds support for the colorization styles (such as chromeColor and symbolColor) and supports excluding specific skin parts from colorization, or for specifying symbols to colorize.

item.question: True or False: To create a Custom skin you should extend from the Skin Class when your require support for the colorization styles (such as chromeColor and symbolColor)?

question.feedback: True. Static parts are instantiated automatically by the skin. There can be only one instance of a static part. For example, the VScrollBar class has four static parts: track, thumb, incrementButton, and decrementButton but there can only be one instance of each of them.

item.question: True or False: There can be only one instance of static skin parts in a custom Skin class?

question.feedback: A is correct. Since the clipAndEnableScrolling property is set to true, the image will be clipped to the size of the container. Scrollbars are not added automatically.

item.question:
Given the following snippet of code, which statement best describes how the image would be displayed?
<s:Group clipAndEnableScrolling="true" width="100" height="100">
<mx:Image width="100" height="100" source="@Embed(source='logo.png')"/>
</s:Group>
item.answer: The logo image is half displayed and no scrollbars are added
Horizontal and Vertical scrollbars are added
